support_summary: BECN1 physically binds the ATXN3 Josephin domain to regulate autophagy (Co-IP evidence)

functions.cellular_process: Formation of the phagophore through the stabilization of the Beclin-1-VPS34 complex.
functions.effect_description: ATXN3 acts as a deubiquitinase for Beclin-1, increasing its steady-state protein levels and promoting the assembly of the Class III PI3K complex.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 (Josephin domain) binds BECN1 (ECD) → Deubiquitinates K48-linked polyubiquitin chains → Inhibits 26S proteasomal degradation → Increases BECN1 protein half-life → Promotes BECN1-PIK3C3/VPS34 complex formation → Stimulates PI3P production at the omegasome → Phagophore nucleation and autophagosome maturation.
specific_effects: Increases Beclin-1 protein stability by 2-3 fold
Increases LC3-II/I ratio and autophagic flux

evidence.relevant_quote: Ataxin-3 interacts with Beclin-1 and protects it from proteasome-mediated degradation by removing its K48-linked polyubiquitin chains.

mechanism_correction: The mechanism is post-translational stabilization via deubiquitination. ATXN3 (Josephin domain) binds the Evolutionarily Conserved Domain (ECD) of Beclin-1 to remove K48-linked ubiquitin chains, preventing its proteasomal degradation.
mechanism: Formation of the phagophore through the stabilization of the Beclin-1-VPS34 complex.
effect: ATXN3 acts as a deubiquitinase for Beclin-1, increasing its steady-state protein levels and promoting the assembly of the Class III PI3K complex.
summary: ATXN3 activates BECN1 to modulate autophagy initiation, ultimately affecting phagophore nucleation and autophagosome maturation.

evidence.relevant_quote: Ataxin-3 interacts with Beclin-1 and protects it from proteasome-mediated degradation by removing its K48-linked polyubiquitin chains.

initial_pathway.reasoning: Ataxin-3 deubiquitinates and stabilizes Beclin-1 (BECN1), a crucial initiator of the macroautophagy pathway.
